Topic.Title: Are Ricky and Echo really front names for an organization?

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: While I was in the army I took a USAFI Course in Accounting. After discharge I got my bachelors degree from USC and went into Accounting for 21 years. I didn't pass the CPA exam until 1961 because I worked mostly in commercial accounting rather than CPA firms. We did have a Sir George's in Pasadena but I think it is now closed like most of them are. It was a company store and the company went out of business. There are still some of the franchises operating independently and doing rather well. I grew up in Pasadena and the house I lived in is now part of the parking lot for Lake Avenue Congregational Church where I attended until 1949 when I left Pasadena and bought my first house in Torrance. I have done taxes for friends and family ever since 1950 when I graduated from USC but didn't really get serious about it until after I retired and finished building my third house in Hesperia. Electronic filing of tax returns was just getting started and I opened a service bureau to provide that service to tax preparation firms. After a couple of years I realized that my client companies were making much more money than I was so when a couple of my clients wanted to retire I bought their business. Now I want to retire and can't find anyone to buy my business. Well I really haven't tried very hard.

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: As for the option trading thing, I just got serious about that about a year ago when I subscribed to a service that put out a trade every week and virtually never lost. They tell subscribers exactly the spread to get the maximum profit with a minimum risk. They trade in weekly SPX options that are so far out of the money that they expire worthless. On Wednesday they tell us the spread to sell, usually for a 30 cent credit, so we are only in the trade for three days. Well I started dabbling in T options and found I could do even better by purchasing cheap "out of the money" weekly options on Thursday and Friday for the following week. If I think T is too high I buy puts and if it is too low I buy calls. Using those two days to load up I go into the new week with an equal number of calls and puts. T invariably moves enough so I can recover the entire investment by selling either the call or put depending on which way it moves. The one I keep is pure profit when I sell it if I am lucky enough to get a move back to where it is worth something, and it usually does. I am not a professional shorter. In fact I am not a professional anything. I'm just having fun.

"we can't deduct that money from our tax burden." Charitable work means you work for FREE, you do not get paid any money, so there is NO money to deduct from your taxes because you didn't get paid any money to deduct.

You, sir, are a fine example of the conservative work ethic wherein you worked hard, took risks and made it on your own. The liberals, on the other hand, would say you are a rich Republican who made it on the backs of the poor workers you hired and exploited for your personal financial gain.

I don't know about liberals, but I wouldn't say any such thing. It sounds like a well lived life, and like he created opportunity for many people as they created opportunity for him. But I also think he wouldn't have had as many VWs to fix without the interstate highway system, or without good union jobs that created a large middle class able to afford multiple vehicles. And that the state's role in regulating accountants and the Federal role in regulating accounting likely increased his income. And that absolutely no one would eat at a place called "Sir George's Smorgasbord" without the FDA, the USDA and health inspectors make sure the food was safe (which also lower food costs and insurance costs). It is easy to see wilkes' individual initiative. It is much harder to see all those things that made his initiative more lucrative for him and for the economy as a whole. It is also much easier to see the cost of taxes than the cost of a restaurant having to buy more liability insurance or the cost of having fewer cars to repair because the road system is #$%$, or because wages are so low no one can afford to eat out or buy a car. It is not a matter of this side or that side getting rich off the backs of the other side, which is what both liberals and conservatives argue. It is about an integrated web of relationships. If any part of that web is weakened, the whole web is at risk. We should do our best to keep all parts strong.

...“I was in the garage with tax stuff spread out over a 4ft. X 8ft. table with all media off…” – jon the procrastinator, trying to explain why he was blaming the Mayor and Governor of New York (those dastardly liberals) for a terrorist event in Massachusetts. So you do your taxes in the garage, do you, jon? Where do you work on your cars…in the kitchen? You must be a very well organized individual, jon. It’s Monday night, April 15th, with the deadline for filing taxes about 3 or 4 hours away. Some 4 hours earlier, his country has been attacked by terrorists, but jon’s in the garage pouring over 32 square feet of receipts, records and statements getting a jump start on filing his tax returns before midnight for 2012. I guess you can really maximize your deductions when you’re working under pressure like that, huh, jon? And you come here offering investment strategy to people? You’ve had three and a half months to prepare your taxes…maybe if you spent less time making a fool out of yourself here, you could have had them done long ago. Or, better yet, wilkes could have done them for you. Let’s see here…wilkes is the tax preparer, but jon’s sudden excuse for not knowing where his country was attacked was that he was pouring over his tax returns in his garage…coincidence???? I think not.

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: Thanks for the tip. Here it is with paragraphs but I had to split it into two posts because of yahoo's post size limitations. You may not expect an answer but it is a good question and deserves a good answer.. It was 1971 and I made the mistake of giving an honest answer to a franchisee of my employer (Sir George's Smorgasbord). He had been waiting over a year after paying his $25,000 franchise fee and asked me when he would likely see some action on his franchise. He was not the only one waiting and, from my vantage point, I knew that the company was using the franchise fees for operating capital. I told him that it was doubtful that he would ever see any action. (he didn't) I was fired. I was 43 and obviously didn't get good recommendations from my previous employer. I had tinkered with mechanical work ever since I was 7 and built my first bike with parts from a trash bin at a bicycle shop two blocks from my house. While I was looking for another job a friend from church asked me if I could fix his VW Square-back. I did and he was so pleased with the work and the low price he sent a couple of his friends. Dido with those two. Within a few weeks I had VW's parked in front of my house, some without engines while I was rebuilding them.

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: I lived in an upscale area in Yorba Linda, CA. and, although none of my neighbors had complained, I didn't think it was going to be long before they did. So I rented a small shop a couple miles away and I hired a young man to help me. That lasted a little over a year and I moved to a larger shop and hired two more mechanics. A couple years latter I rented the adjacent shop and I was doing very little mechanical work myself. I spent my time setting up a machine shop to do work in house that we had been sending out. In 1982 I moved to an 8,000 SF shop in Placentia and soon had 8 mechanics all working on air cooled VW's. We were rebuilding and installing 3 engines a day. Five years later the VW craze was coming to an end and we were branching out into all other cars. I didn't like it so I sold the business and retired. Less

...“The wife had the 73 Beetle…” The jon The Wife had The Beetle until she got tired of me calling her The Wife, and grabbed The Wrench, hit me upside The Head, causing The Concussion and The Hospitalization of The jon, which led to The Lawyers, The Court, The Divorce, The Alimony, The Loss of The Bank account, The House, The Guns, The Bass boat, The Airstream Trailer, The Retirement Savings, The Life…all I’ve got is The Dog, The ’77 Yugo and The Ulcers…Oh, The Humanity…The End.

Message.Msg: Why(??) don't you two just go out on a date together, and spare us the rest of us your beautiful courtship? Wilkes, you are clearly not the brightest "bulb" in the chandelier. Why are you going into great detail about your life with a complete, anonymous stranger on a Yahoo message board? You have your Yahoo ID tied to your real name, phone number and address and now you are handing out your life history for anyone and everyone who looks at this board to see. Understand that there are people who look at this board that are more nefarious than the day to day gadflies. You are a perfect patsy for ID theft. Don't be surprised if you find that you have taken out credit cards and car loans that you knew nothing about. You're way too old to be this stupid (!!)

Message.Title: DUCP looks prime for a breakout
Message.Msg: I heard there is a massive promo coming into DUCP. Keep an eye on it

Message.Title: T holding up well in down market
Message.Msg: T is down only about half as much as the Dow. This in spite of the fact that the Stochastic for T crossed below 80 yesterday indicating sell. At the same time VZ has fallen much more than the Dow today even thought its' Stochastic remains above 80 where it has been for 2.5 months while VZ climbed from $42 to $50. During that same time frame T climbed from $33 to $38.50. Not quite as good as VZ but certainly not bad. I expect T to drop to $37 before resuming the climb to $40 but don't count on it.

Message.Msg: Don't make my identity assumptions. I'm more interested in topics other than the NRA, Obama and all the other BS I see and move past. I don't question the echos or crewfaces motives because i could care less. By my questioning someone, it reveals something about them. The personal additives are not meant for everyone, anymore than other posters trying to force their humor (childish), political, sexual innuendo or personal agendas. It may not be for everyone, but that's what happens on public forums. Like it or not, that's what you get.

Topic.Title: Oh no say it isn't so!

Message.Msg: There are stats that the earth is getting warmer. It has done it before. It has cooled before. We have been for the past nearly 100 years trying to do things to reduce man caused pollution and it has improved our air quality a great deal. To be arrogant enough to think that we caused all the heating and that we have it in our power to control or change nature is simply stupid. We should and are doing what we can in this country to keep improving our air quality and pollution in general. The rest of the world in some very major parts are NOT! We cannot do it all alone, we cannot pay for it all with our treasury, and we are fools if we think we can. Much of the government’s actions are to pad their own pockets, increase taxes that will not be spent on the items for which they claim the money in intended. A great many of those saying we are headed the wrong way and those saying they are wrong are talking to be paid for what they say or just to hear their own voices in public media.

Topic.Title: Oh no say it isn't so!

Message.Msg: The scientific consensus is that global warming is real and it is man made. Since it is a man made phenomenon it is certainly within our control to do something about it. It was the United States that pulled out of the Kyoto Protocol, not the rest of the world. You may be washed up and cynical. You may be content to let China or Europe take the lead on what is the major issue of the 21st Century. I am not. America led the way with the sulfur dioxide cap and trade system and we ended the problem of acid rain. There is no reason we cannot do it again.
You don't think we go after shooters? What a ridiculous statement.
It makes sense to them, which is amazing. They hang on to tired excuses with no further thought.
Law-bidding citizens. That's a good way to describe the NRA.
Heck, it's a good way to describe the Republican Party.
He also seems to think he can buy pre-made bombs at Walmart.

You can buy the "ingredients" for an AR-15 too, Jon. What you can't buy is a ready made mass killing device--except for AR-15s. Remember Lanza fired 155 rounds in less than two minutes, killing 26 people and wounding two more in two separate rooms separated by another classroom. I don't think an AR-15 is any less deadly than the devices used in Boston. The difference is the devices used in Boston are illegal to construct, possess or sell. It is illegal to manufacture them in large quantities for mass distribution to any idiot who can't write a sentence. But AR-15s are available at Walmart to anyone at any time.

Message.Msg: ...“Another ‘attack’ tennacle (sic) of echo…” – speller jon Jon, what exactly is a tennacle? Like the London Marathon question which you’re apparently still researching, we’ll give you some help by making it multiple choice: a. Tennacle – one more than nineacle. b. Tennacle – what you call uncle number ten. c. Tennacle - what jon’s doctor is holding when he asks him to turn his head and cough. d. Tennacle – the most cynical you can be on a scale of one to ten. e. Tennacle – identical to tentacle but spelled by jon. “…try focusing on some of the better things in life…” I’ll pass, jon. I know you enjoy those things…like inbreeding, catfish noodling, taxidermy, potato cannons, burping the entire album “Greatest Hits of Luderin Darbone and His Hackberry Ramblers”, duct tape sculpture, WWF, plunking beer bottles in the back yard, watching and betting on NASCAR re-runs played on fast rewind (BETA) and serving as the heavily armed guard at the entrance to your gated community, Double Wide Holler Heaven, where you protect the neighbors (mostly crack heads and incestuous ex-cons) from encroachment by insidious outsiders who might be promoting a “socialist” agenda. Alas, it sounds like a vibrant and exciting lifestyle you lead, jon, but, perhaps just a bit too cerebral for me.

What an ignorant, over-broad statement. I am a law abiding citizen and am not and never have been a member of the NRA. If you don't understand or agree with an organization, group or a common thought process your approach is to tear it down rather than try to understand it. Liberals abound here, you can tell by their narrow views of the world.
Just as ignorant, narrow minded and prejudiced as your NRA comment. You don't seem to learn from you own stupid mistakes do you?

Topic.Title: June 41 calls are selling for 14 cents

Message.Msg: Not to worry Wilkie. I have no ulterior motive to steal our name, identity, bank account or whatever. I post my name freely and don't give a damn who knows it. If someone tries scamming me, it won't get them jack. I got my bases covered. Who is to say I am in fact Dave Martin anymore than echo is echo? It's only a user name my friend. Your background was interesting and if other viewers enjoyed it as I did, good for them. For those who viewed it as The Dating Game, so be it. I cant change that juvenile mentality. I suppose there is a risk in revealing too much. I don't think you crossed that threshold. I do take exception to your being viewed a a dim lightbulb...or words to that effect...by Zobac. That's his opinion. I wont argue that with him. Granted you have lost a bundle, but as you wrote for all to see, you figured it out and now turn a profit. I commend you for that. Continued good luck in the option plays you make. It's still not for me. This weeks stock hit seems tied to the DOJ or FCC trying to limit T and VZ from snagging spectrum at the upcoming auction. Once that blows over with some modest profit taking as well, the march forward resumes. The 23rd should be revealing with the earnings forecast. Watch for a nice pop when it beats estimates. Tomorrow is VZ with in-line to a penny less. We'll see how that shakes out.

Message.Title: Wonderful speech
Message.Msg: Did you hear The President's speech this evening? Obama did a great job presenting the case for reasonable gun control, and castigated a Congress that is not responsive to its constituents. "Do they really think that 1,000s of families whose lives have been changed by gun violence have no right to be heard on this matter?" Every day that I wake up and Obama is The President, I say a quiet prayer of thanks (!!)
an excellent post, zonbac
